intro: Sebastiania mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, fleshy berries that turn from green to purple as they mature. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are unisexual and clustered in spikes. The berries are an important food source for various bird species, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
